abstract: Internal Revenue Service proposes regulation that would end allowing private equity firms to artificially lower their partners' personal income tax bills.
lead_paragraph: Private equity firms are permitted to convert management fees into capital contributions, and profits are treated as capital gains or dividend income and taxed at a much lower rate.

headline.main: I.R.S. Targets Tax Dodge by Private Equity Firms
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Targets Tax Dodge by Private Equity Firms

snippet: Private equity firms are permitted to convert management fees into capital contributions, and profits are treated as capital gains or dividend income and taxed at a much lower rate.
